KH.content: btwn text & theme, structure w/out an indivisible origin > theater of irony, w/out end, w/out bottom [abyss]; to isolate a theme, “philosophy-of-Plato,” would be to violently misrecognize, deny textual scene, questions of topology in general
KH.linkedContent: btwn text & theme, structure w/out an indivisible origin > theater of irony, w/out end, w/out bottom [abyss]; to isolate a theme, “philosophy-of-Plato,” would be to violently misrecognize, deny textual scene, questions of topology in general

KH.content: “Platonism” a necessary effect of Plato’s texts has dominated (in name of philosophy) by way of arbitrary violence (making the law) other motifs at work in the text
KH.linkedContent: “Platonism” a necessary effect of Plato’s texts has dominated (in name of philosophy) by way of arbitrary violence (making the law) other motifs at work in the text

KH.content: turns back against the text, w/ a violent reversion that’s always interested & interesting [says same thing about Nietzsche]
KH.linkedContent: turns back against the text, w/ a violent reversion that’s always interested & interesting [says same thing about Nietzsche]

KH.content: “Platonism” not only neutralizes Plato’s texts, inhibiting forces that continue to maintain a certain disorder (parasitism, ventriloquism, clandestinity, tone of denial), “Platonism” commands whole history of this neutralization, a philosophy would always be “Platonic”
KH.linkedContent: “Platonism” not only neutralizes Plato’s texts, inhibiting forces that continue to maintain a certain disorder (parasitism, ventriloquism, clandestinity, tone of denial), “Platonism” commands whole history of this neutralization, a philosophy would always be “Platonic”

GT.content: language elle vole, elle nous souffle, withdraws (soustrait) responsibility it seems to inaugurate, this originary supplementarity extends beyond language in strict sense to all textuality
GT.linkedContent: language elle vole, elle nous souffle, withdraws (soustrait) responsibility it seems to inaugurate, this originary supplementarity extends beyond language in strict sense to all textuality

GT.content: text [“Counterfeit Money”]: a machine for provoking events
et nous ne pouvons pas faire autrement que partir des textes, et des textes en tant qu’ils partent (qu’ils se séparent, d’eux-mêmes et de leur origine, de nous) dès le départ [even if we wished to]
GT.linkedContent: et nous ne pouvons pas faire autrement que partir des textes, et des textes en tant qu’ils partent (qu’ils se séparent, d’eux-mêmes et de leur origine, de nous) dès le départ [even if we wished to]

OOG.content: text depends on writer or reader (haunted by a virtual intentionality), otherwise it would have no transcendental function [for Husserl?]
OOG.linkedContent: text depends on writer or reader (haunted by a virtual intentionality), otherwise it would have no transcendental function [for Husserl?]

FL.content: for Benjamin, text & signature are specters which exhibit & archive their implosion, in ruins, [Derrida now affirms this “stance”] such is status of deconstructive text: cannot escape law it enunciates, ruins & contaminates itself [at once founding/preserving], becomes specter of itself
FL.linkedContent: for Benjamin, text & signature are specters which exhibit & archive their implosion, in ruins, [Derrida now affirms this “stance”] such is status of deconstructive text: cannot escape law it enunciates, ruins & contaminates itself [at once founding/preserving], becomes specter of itself

BL.content: ci falt (thus ends, fails, is lacking, is necessary (faut) a text)
BL.linkedContent: ci falt (thus ends, fails, is lacking, is necessary (faut) a text)

LOBL.content: to approach a text it must have an edge [arêtes: edge, stop]
LOBL.linkedContent: to approach a text it must have an edge [arêtes: edge, stop]

LOBL.content: text overruns all the limits assigned to it, but I’m not trying to transform the world into a library by doing away w/ all boundaries, framework, all sharp edges (all arêtes)
LOBL.linkedContent: text overruns all the limits assigned to it, but I’m not trying to transform the world into a library by doing away w/ all boundaries, framework, all sharp edges (all arêtes)

LOBL.content: text lives on only if it lives on (sur-vit), it lives on only if it is at once (hama) translatable and untranslatable
LOBL.linkedContent: text lives on only if it lives on (sur-vit), it lives on only if it is at once (hama) translatable and untranslatable

LOBL.content: no paradigmatic text, only cryptic haunting from mark to mark, no piece, metonymy, integral corpus, thus no fetishism
LOBL.linkedContent: no paradigmatic text, only cryptic haunting from mark to mark, no piece, metonymy, integral corpus, thus no fetishism

LOBL.content: translation as transference, transference is love, one text loves the other in translation
LOBL.linkedContent: translation as transference, transference is love, one text loves the other in translation

LOBL.content: how do we let a text live? letting someone read is like letting them live [re: Derrida pointing us toward Blanchot]
LOBL.linkedContent: how do we let a text live? letting someone read is like letting them live [re: Derrida pointing us toward Blanchot]

MPM.content: all figures are ghostly figures, speak like phantoms and phantomize the text > never define trace or phantom w/out ironically/allegorically appealing from one to the other
MPM.linkedContent: all figures are ghostly figures, speak like phantoms and phantomize the text > never define trace or phantom w/out ironically/allegorically appealing from one to the other

MPM.content: de Man: no need to deconstruct Rousseau, already done so himself > texts deconstruct themselves by themselves [Derrida agrees w/ stipulation on use of “itself (se)]
MPM.linkedContent: de Man: no need to deconstruct Rousseau, already done so himself > texts deconstruct themselves by themselves [Derrida agrees w/ stipulation on use of “itself (se)]

MPM.content: for de Man, text defined by considering a statement at the same time performative & constative > this same time never is, will never have been, will never be present
MPM.linkedContent: for de Man, text defined by considering a statement at the same time performative & constative > this same time never is, will never have been, will never be present

MPM.content: disjunction of memory & promise is the law, the text of law, the law of text
MPM.linkedContent: disjunction of memory & promise is the law, the text of law, the law of text

EM.content: for Heidegger, exemplary interrogated (Befragte) being [man] constitutes privileged text for a reading of meaning of Being
EM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, exemplary interrogated (Befragte) being [man] constitutes privileged text for a reading of meaning of Being

EM.content: Dasein serves as exemplary text to read Being, l’homme reste le lien ou le fil conducteur paléonymique that ties analytic of Dasein to totality of metaphysical tradition
EM.linkedContent: Dasein serves as exemplary text to read Being, l’homme reste le lien ou le fil conducteur paléonymique that ties analytic of Dasein to totality of metaphysical tradition

EM.content: “on voit donc que le Dasein, s’il n’est pas l’homme, n’est pourtant pas autre chose que l’homme”
EM.linkedContent: “on voit donc que le Dasein, s’il n’est pas l’homme, n’est pourtant pas autre chose que l’homme”

EM.content: Heidegger destroys privilege of present-now (Gegenwart) by way of a presence (Anwesen, Anwesenheit) which 3 modes of present (present-present, past-present, future-present) can’t exhaust > provides playing space (l’espace de jeu) on basis of the fourfold (On Time and Being), “an alternative always suspended over its ‘own proper’ abysm”: it is the text of dissemination
EM.linkedContent: Heidegger destroys privilege of present-now (Gegenwart) by way of a presence (Anwesen, Anwesenheit) which 3 modes of present (present-present, past-present, future-present) can’t exhaust > provides playing space (l’espace de jeu) on basis of the fourfold (On Time and Being), “an alternative always suspended over its ‘own proper’ abysm”: it is the text of dissemination

PP.content: text is forever imperceptible, its laws and rules [legibility?] are not “harbored in the inaccessibility of a secret,” but can never be booked (se livrent) in the present ——text “run[s] the risk of being definitively lost, who will ever know of such disappearances?”
PP.linkedContent: text is forever imperceptible, its laws and rules [legibility?] are not “harbored in the inaccessibility of a secret,” but can never be booked (se livrent) in the present ——text “run[s] the risk of being definitively lost, who will ever know of such disappearances?”

PP.content: text as web (toile), can dissimulate itself for centuries, regenerate its own tissue behind cutting trace
PP.linkedContent: text as web (toile), can dissimulate itself for centuries, regenerate its own tissue behind cutting trace

PP.content: Plato cannot see the links (les liasons), les laisser dans l’ombre ou les y interrompre > they go on working, outside his text? thanks to him? in his text? outside his text?
PP.linkedContent: Plato cannot see the links (les liasons), les laisser dans l’ombre ou les y interrompre > they go on working, outside his text? thanks to him? in his text? outside his text?

PP.content: textuality is absolutely heterogenous, constantly “composing with the forces that tend to annihilate (annuler) it”
PP.linkedContent: textuality is absolutely heterogenous, constantly “composing with the forces that tend to annihilate (annuler) it”

F.content: [re: Abraham’s psychoanalysis] joy of breaking wall btwn rational & irrational, condition necessary for “scientific truth and poetic truth” to belong to “same essence”
F.linkedContent: [re: Abraham’s psychoanalysis] joy of breaking wall btwn rational & irrational, condition necessary for “scientific truth and poetic truth” to belong to “same essence”

F.content: this poetic truth not gratuitous literary estheticism, nor unveiling presence > truth is “poetic” in that it writes a text on and in a text, hieroglyph on hieroglyph
F.linkedContent: this poetic truth not gratuitous literary estheticism, nor unveiling presence > truth is “poetic” in that it writes a text on and in a text, hieroglyph on hieroglyph

F.content: ultimate object still remains, even as “proper” name or body—a text to be deciphered
F.linkedContent: ultimate object still remains, even as “proper” name or body—a text to be deciphered

F.content: encrypted, coded text written on crypt is not written on a pre-existing partition, the partition is the material of the text
F.linkedContent: encrypted, coded text written on crypt is not written on a pre-existing partition, the partition is the material of the text

DS.content: relation of one text to another, open & closed, at the same time > necessary that each organism only refer to itself as determinate
DS.linkedContent: relation of one text to another, open & closed, at the same time > necessary that each organism only refer to itself as determinate

DS.content: “re-presentation” [Derrida via Mallarmé]: less concerned with setting forth things, the image of things, than setting up a machine > repetition-toward-itself of text as re-folding
DS.linkedContent: “re-presentation” [Derrida via Mallarmé]: less concerned with setting forth things, the image of things, than setting up a machine > repetition-toward-itself of text as re-folding

DS.content: paragraph woven like textile, copious veil, fabric being spread out before & stitched down, histological operation pierces/joins w/ point, nothing but text, cut through, gathered up
DS.linkedContent: paragraph woven like textile, copious veil, fabric being spread out before & stitched down, histological operation pierces/joins w/ point, nothing but text, cut through, gathered up

DS.content: “themes” run aground (échoue) at edge lesser & greater than theme, where “there is” a text is made a possibility, a readability w/out signified (fright’s reflex declares: unreadable)
DS.linkedContent: “themes” run aground (échoue) at edge lesser & greater than theme, where “there is” a text is made a possibility, a readability w/out signified (fright’s reflex declares: unreadable)

DS.content: no total/proper meaning because blank folds over (se plie), dès que le blanc (est) blanc, (se) blanchit, as soon as there’s a mark, there’s a re-mark, no blank w/ capital B, no theology of Text, yet desire for reappropriation, structural site of theological trap, is produced, nourished, in very act of separating from it > le pli (se) plie: son sens s’espace d’une double marque, au creux de laquelle un blanc se plie
DS.linkedContent: no total/proper meaning because blank folds over (se plie), dès que le blanc (est) blanc, (se) blanchit, as soon as there’s a mark, there’s a re-mark, no blank w/ capital B, no theology of Text, yet desire for reappropriation, structural site of theological trap, is produced, nourished, in very act of separating from it > le pli (se) plie: son sens s’espace d’une double marque, au creux de laquelle un blanc se plie

DS.content: hymen not even a signifier or sign [an event?], thus everything that comes from propagation-structure of hymen, i.e. text, is never truly made up of “signs” or “signifiers”
DS.linkedContent: hymen not even a signifier or sign [an event?], thus everything that comes from propagation-structure of hymen, i.e. text, is never truly made up of “signs” or “signifiers”

DS.content: si le texte à la lettre n’existe pas, there is (il y a), perhaps, a text, en marche, avec lequel il faut frayer ——if fold had a limit somewhere, if mark, margin, or marche (limit, threshold, border) was fold’s other > there would be no text
DS.linkedContent: si le texte à la lettre n’existe pas, there is (il y a), perhaps, a text, en marche, avec lequel il faut frayer ——if fold had a limit somewhere, if mark, margin, or marche (limit, threshold, border) was fold’s other > there would be no text

POS.content: gram as differance neutralizes phonologistic propensity of “sign,” liberates “graphic substance” > gram not an element, interwoven w/ traces of other elements of chain/system
POS.linkedContent: gram as differance neutralizes phonologistic propensity of “sign,” liberates “graphic substance” > gram not an element, interwoven w/ traces of other elements of chain/system

POS.content: this interweaving, this textile, is the text > produced only in transformation of another text
POS.linkedContent: this interweaving, this textile, is the text > produced only in transformation of another text

POS.content: from perspective of expressivism, text is nonsignifying, from perspective of differance, text produces all signification, “only nonexpressivity can signify,” “interiority” of meaning already worked over by its own exteriority
POS.linkedContent: from perspective of expressivism, text is nonsignifying, from perspective of differance, text produces all signification, “only nonexpressivity can signify,” “interiority” of meaning already worked over by its own exteriority

POS.content: there’s a general text, an overflow, everywhere a discourse and its order (essence, meaning, ideality, consciousness) is put back into position of mark in a chain that this authorizing discourse believes it governs (and it does [?])
POS.linkedContent: there’s a general text, an overflow, everywhere a discourse and its order (essence, meaning, ideality, consciousness) is put back into position of mark in a chain that this authorizing discourse believes it governs (and it does [?])

POS.content: (writing of text has exterior limit of a certain re-mark [?]) general text not limited to writing on page, that’s only a determined type, like “literature,” of this re-mark
POS.linkedContent: (writing of text has exterior limit of a certain re-mark [?]) general text not limited to writing on page, that’s only a determined type, like “literature,” of this re-mark

POS.content: “text” not reducible to sensible or visible presence of graphic or the “literal”
POS.linkedContent: “text” not reducible to sensible or visible presence of graphic or the “literal”

POS.content: cannot expect “efficacity” of theory/praxis of deconstruction to be immediate, deferred acc. complex networks > regional “effects” of this trembling have a nonregional opening [to the, in the, “general text” (which is neither a reflection nor an effect)] > no pretention to mastery
POS.linkedContent: cannot expect “efficacity” of theory/praxis of deconstruction to be immediate, deferred acc. complex networks > regional “effects” of this trembling have a nonregional opening [to the, in the, “general text” (which is neither a reflection nor an effect)] > no pretention to mastery

SP.content: possible forgetting [?] of their code makes all texts open, undecipherable, and structurally posthumous (the author will die w/ the key inside, will forget it even)
SP.linkedContent: possible forgetting [?] of their code makes all texts open, undecipherable, and structurally posthumous (the author will die w/ the key inside, will forget it even)

SP.content: were the key to the secret of a text “btwn me and myself,” I will still die > relation to event of text as structurally posthumous necessity > text remains open, offered, undecipherable
SP.linkedContent: were the key to the secret of a text “btwn me and myself,” I will still die > relation to event of text as structurally posthumous necessity > text remains open, offered, undecipherable

SP.content: la signature et le texte tombent l’un hors de l’autre, se sécrètent, se séparent, et s’excrètent, se forment de la coupure même qui les décapite, les échafaude en tronc sans tête, dès l’instant de leur itérabilité > expropriative commencement marks everything erected w/ structure of etron [fecal matter]
SP.linkedContent: la signature et le texte tombent l’un hors de l’autre, se sécrètent, se séparent, et s’excrètent, se forment de la coupure même qui les décapite, les échafaude en tronc sans tête, dès l’instant de leur itérabilité > expropriative commencement marks everything erected w/ structure of etron [fecal matter]

DIF.content: w/out displaced reinscription of ontological chain the relation btwn ontology and whatever it masters will not be transformed rigorously and irreversibly > this reinscription will not be found in philosophical discourse, only on scene of text in general
DIF.linkedContent: w/out displaced reinscription of ontological chain the relation btwn ontology and whatever it masters will not be transformed rigorously and irreversibly > this reinscription will not be found in philosophical discourse, only on scene of text in general

O.content: this new text, c’est aussi le débord infini de sa représentation classique, a breakthrough (effraction), lining fringe [?], de-limitation, would be called a posteriority or an empiricism [by Hegel]
O.linkedContent: this new text, c’est aussi le débord infini de sa représentation classique, a breakthrough (effraction), lining fringe [?], de-limitation, would be called a posteriority or an empiricism [by Hegel]

O.content: avancer qu’il n’y a pas de hors-texte absolu, ce n’est pas postuler une immanence idéale > not an idealist/theological operation, le texte affirme le dehors, deconstructs & reduces predicates of speculative operation (appropriation of outside) to “effects”
O.linkedContent: avancer qu’il n’y a pas de hors-texte absolu, ce n’est pas postuler une immanence idéale > not an idealist/theological operation, le texte affirme le dehors, deconstructs & reduces predicates of speculative operation (appropriation of outside) to “effects”

O.content: if nothing outside text, text not snug airtight (calfeutré) inside of an interiority or an identity-to-itself (d’une identité à soi) > though “dehors à tout prix” can play a reassuring role, un certain dedans peut être terrible
O.linkedContent: if nothing outside text, text not snug airtight (calfeutré) inside of an interiority or an identity-to-itself (d’une identité à soi) > though “dehors à tout prix” can play a reassuring role, un certain dedans peut être terrible

O.content: text (l’au-delà du tout) resists ontology > not primum movens > il imprime pourtant au tout, depuis le “dedans” du système où il marque ses effets de colonne vide et inscrite, un mouvement de fiction
O.linkedContent: text (l’au-delà du tout) resists ontology > not primum movens > il imprime pourtant au tout, depuis le “dedans” du système où il marque ses effets de colonne vide et inscrite, un mouvement de fiction

TB.content: vis-à-vis Benjamin, if structure of work is “sur-vival,” a strange debt that doesn’t bind anyone to anyone: debt not engaged w/ subject-author but to formal law in immanence of original text
TB.linkedContent: vis-à-vis Benjamin, if structure of work is “sur-vival,” a strange debt that doesn’t bind anyone to anyone: debt not engaged w/ subject-author but to formal law in immanence of original text

TB.content: sacred text is transferability making its translation untranslatable
sacred text (absolute text): pas de sens (not poverty of meaning, but no meaning that would be itself) > sacred text surrenders itself to translation; commands right away the translation it refuses
TB.linkedContent: sacred text (absolute text): pas de sens (not poverty of meaning, but no meaning that would be itself) > sacred text surrenders itself to translation; commands right away the translation it refuses

REST.content: if police there is (and isn’t there always?) > Derrida polices too [?], “close reading,” counterpolices [?] oldest, most dogmatic, sinisterly authoritarian programs, massive meidatizing machines: pre-text of perception, of bare hands (mains nue), of real history, of living speech (vous enferme en tout hâte dans un prétendu hors-texte)
REST.linkedContent: if police there is (and isn’t there always?) > Derrida polices too [?], “close reading,” counterpolices [?] oldest, most dogmatic, sinisterly authoritarian programs, massive meidatizing machines: pre-text of perception, of bare hands (mains nue), of real history, of living speech (vous enferme en tout hâte dans un prétendu hors-texte)

REST.content: border between the text as a book and general textuality (w/ no absolute edge) comes away (s’y enlève)—comes away in the sense of Gestalt and effacement
REST.linkedContent: border between the text as a book and general textuality (w/ no absolute edge) comes away (s’y enlève)—comes away in the sense of Gestalt and effacement

TR.content: textual event: calls to question internal/external border
when it’s a matter of structure of text, concept of historicity not regulated by teleological process but by the event, by singularity of “one time only”
TR.linkedContent: when it’s a matter of structure of text, concept of historicity not regulated by teleological process but by the event, by singularity of “one time only”

TR.content: no text conceivable w/out grammar (machine), no machine w/out “suspension of referential meaning”
TR.linkedContent: no text conceivable w/out grammar (machine), no machine w/out “suspension of referential meaning”

TR.content: de Man: text is generative, open-ended, non-referential grammatical system & a figural system closed off by a transcendental signification that subverts code to which it owes its existence
TR.linkedContent: de Man: text is generative, open-ended, non-referential grammatical system & a figural system closed off by a transcendental signification that subverts code to which it owes its existence

TR.content: de Man: text as body (always retraceable to metaphor) displaced [deconstructed] by text as machine, in this process suffers loss of illusion of meaning [dis-figuration, de-metaphorization]
TR.linkedContent: de Man: text as body (always retraceable to metaphor) displaced [deconstructed] by text as machine, in this process suffers loss of illusion of meaning [dis-figuration, de-metaphorization]

EJQB.content: text as weed (mauvaise herbe) and outlaw (hors la Loi)
EJQB.linkedContent: text as weed (mauvaise herbe) and outlaw (hors la Loi)

D.content: Soller’s Numbers is exemplary re: the reader, cette fois enfin, the text shows (montrée) that a reader cannot choose his/her place in a text > does so by composing surfaces retournées & par une mise en scène matérielle exacte
D.linkedContent: Soller’s Numbers is exemplary re: the reader, cette fois enfin, the text shows (montrée) that a reader cannot choose his/her place in a text > does so by composing surfaces retournées & par une mise en scène matérielle exacte

D.content: [let’s mark in hollow, mute, invisible angle] statistical accumulation of “quotations,” [like constraints of that angle] accumulation as feigning to present the text > “this” text & all that touches it—still “that” text; generalized simulacrum: intertext of 2 fictions (btwn primary text & commentary) [Derrida will call D “this” text w/ a certain irony]
D.linkedContent: [let’s mark in hollow, mute, invisible angle] statistical accumulation of “quotations,” [like constraints of that angle] accumulation as feigning to present the text > “this” text & all that touches it—still “that” text; generalized simulacrum: intertext of 2 fictions (btwn primary text & commentary) [Derrida will call D “this” text w/ a certain irony]

D.content: the inside of text will always have been outside it; reciprocal contamination of body proper, violent expatriation, poison affirmed—mercury in its tain
D.linkedContent: the inside of text will always have been outside it; reciprocal contamination of body proper, violent expatriation, poison affirmed—mercury in its tain

D.content: through mirror-effect (germinates/deforms), each sequence of text comprehends another > each part smaller than themselves & greater than the whole they reflect
D.linkedContent: through mirror-effect (germinates/deforms), each sequence of text comprehends another > each part smaller than themselves & greater than the whole they reflect

D.content: figure of quadrangle complicated by strange mirror [imparfait de double fond], mirror as echo that precedes origin it seems to answer > “echo” is an “incision” (X n’étant constitués qu’en retour)
D.linkedContent: figure of quadrangle complicated by strange mirror [imparfait de double fond], mirror as echo that precedes origin it seems to answer > “echo” is an “incision” (X n’étant constitués qu’en retour)

D.content: s’il n’y a pas de hors-texte [outside the text, extratext], it’s because le graphique généralisé a toujours déjà commencé: il n’y a rien avant le texte, always implanted in “prior” writing [no pretext that’s not already text]
D.linkedContent: s’il n’y a pas de hors-texte [outside the text, extratext], it’s because le graphique généralisé a toujours déjà commencé: il n’y a rien avant le texte, always implanted in “prior” writing [no pretext that’s not already text]

D.content: obsessive desire to escape due to structure of the text, obsession always textual
D.linkedContent: obsessive desire to escape due to structure of the text, obsession always textual

D.content: textuality is obsidional: undecidable process of opening/closing—no letup (sans cesse)
D.linkedContent: textuality is obsidional: undecidable process of opening/closing—no letup (sans cesse)

D.content: already plunged by imperfect into already opened thickness of another text
D.linkedContent: already plunged by imperfect into already opened thickness of another text

D.content: text occupies place before “me,” announces me to myself—une tour de guet (watchtower) planted inside me > like a “transparent column,” pure outside: driven into that which tries to close in on itself > imagine you swallowed a cylindrical mirror, tower of Babel, bottomless plurality, not negative…also phallic [p. 342 in Zohar: “great, ungraspable columns of air”]
D.linkedContent: text occupies place before “me,” announces me to myself—une tour de guet (watchtower) planted inside me > like a “transparent column,” pure outside: driven into that which tries to close in on itself > imagine you swallowed a cylindrical mirror, tower of Babel, bottomless plurality, not negative…also phallic [p. 342 in Zohar: “great, ungraspable columns of air”]

D.content: one must choose btwn the text & the theme
D.linkedContent: one must choose btwn the text & the theme

D.content: to write means to graft (same word), each grafted text radiates toward the site of its removal, s’y régénèrent dans la répétition, à la bordure d’un surjet (overcast seam)
D.linkedContent: to write means to graft (same word), each grafted text radiates toward the site of its removal, s’y régénèrent dans la répétition, à la bordure d’un surjet (overcast seam)

D.content: discrete violence of incision not apparent in thickness of text [cf. EJQB p. 78]
D.linkedContent: discrete violence of incision not apparent in thickness of text [cf. EJQB p. 78]

D.content: thickness (l’épaisseur) of text opens upon beyond of a whole, nothing or absolute outside: its depth (sa profondeur) at once null & infinite—each layer (couche) harbors (en abrite) another
D.linkedContent: thickness (l’épaisseur) of text opens upon beyond of a whole, nothing or absolute outside: its depth (sa profondeur) at once null & infinite—each layer (couche) harbors (en abrite) another

+R.content: [quoting Glas] Genet’s text is not exhausted by the pocket Derrida cuts, sews, and binds: it was the text [Genet’s] which pierced a hole in the pocket first
+R.linkedContent: [quoting Glas] Genet’s text is not exhausted by the pocket Derrida cuts, sews, and binds: it was the text [Genet’s] which pierced a hole in the pocket first

+R.content: Adami shows what is forbidden to Glas, out of range of its signatory, signs the absolute reverse of a text: monstration, exhibition, exposes the exposition
+R.linkedContent: Adami shows what is forbidden to Glas, out of range of its signatory, signs the absolute reverse of a text: monstration, exhibition, exposes the exposition

LI.content: phenomenon of repeatability is condition of possibility of survival of text [not vice versa]
LI.linkedContent: phenomenon of repeatability is condition of possibility of survival of text [not vice versa]

LI.content: nothing outside text = nothing outside context [less shocking, more to think about?]
LI.linkedContent: nothing outside text = nothing outside context [less shocking, more to think about?]

LI.content: I’ve said 1000 times, still not heard: text is not the book confined to the library > does not suspend reference to history, reality, being, (and especially) the other
LI.linkedContent: I’ve said 1000 times, still not heard: text is not the book confined to the library > does not suspend reference to history, reality, being, (and especially) the other

LI.content: when Derrida uses the term infrastructural (not meant as substratum beneath Marxist superstructure), but: recalls concept of text, not book, not discourse, not idealogical sphere: all structures called “real,” “economic,” “historical,” socio-institutional > all possible referents
LI.linkedContent: when Derrida uses the term infrastructural (not meant as substratum beneath Marxist superstructure), but: recalls concept of text, not book, not discourse, not idealogical sphere: all structures called “real,” “economic,” “historical,” socio-institutional > all possible referents

LI.content: every referent, all reality, has structure of a differential trace, can only refer to “real” in an interpretive experience
LI.linkedContent: every referent, all reality, has structure of a differential trace, can only refer to “real” in an interpretive experience

ATM.content: [Levinas’ work] a fabrication of quotation marks crocheting a text w/out edge: seriality irreducibly knots a text to a language
ATM.linkedContent: [Levinas’ work] a fabrication of quotation marks crocheting a text w/out edge: seriality irreducibly knots a text to a language

AD.content: hiatus ensures that analysis encounters dissociation in structure of arguments, heterogeneity: text knows how to interrupt itself
AD.linkedContent: hiatus ensures that analysis encounters dissociation in structure of arguments, heterogeneity: text knows how to interrupt itself

LG.content: all texts left open, eternally remarkable—possibility of becoming literature
LG.linkedContent: all texts left open, eternally remarkable—possibility of becoming literature

LG.content: effect of code: in marking itself generically, text unmarks itself (se démarque) > because of trait, text participates in one or several genres
LG.linkedContent: effect of code: in marking itself generically, text unmarks itself (se démarque) > because of trait, text participates in one or several genres

OG.content: book as idea of totality, encyclopedia, requires external signified, is against writing and its aphoristic energy
OG.linkedContent: book as idea of totality, encyclopedia, requires external signified, is against writing and its aphoristic energy

OG.content: violence on both sides: logocentrism (book), deconstruction (text)
Derrida is not concerned w/ Sausurre’s intentions, nor the very thought itself, instead interested in a text which has influenced readings, borrowings, etc.
OG.linkedContent: Derrida is not concerned w/ Sausurre’s intentions, nor the very thought itself, instead interested in a text which has influenced readings, borrowings, etc.

OG.content: Derrida not looking for a truth signified in Rousseau but an engagement and appurtenance “qui enserrent dans le même tissu, le même texte, l’existence et l’écriture”—same [text, tissue] is here called supplement, another name for differance
OG.linkedContent: Derrida not looking for a truth signified in Rousseau but an engagement and appurtenance “qui enserrent dans le même tissu, le même texte, l’existence et l’écriture”—same [text, tissue] is here called supplement, another name for differance

OG.content: doubling commentary: writing that’s a reading, read where writer is surprised [re: surprising resources of Rousseau’s supplement], can’t command his own language > no transcendental signified: il n’y a pas de hors-texte
OG.linkedContent: doubling commentary: writing that’s a reading, read where writer is surprised [re: surprising resources of Rousseau’s supplement], can’t command his own language > no transcendental signified: il n’y a pas de hors-texte

EU.content: single text, doesn’t mean homogenous & continuous text
EU.linkedContent: single text, doesn’t mean homogenous & continuous text

EU.content: interpretation of poem, philosopheme, theologeme always proposes an institutional model, consolidating an existing one or constituting a new one: calls for politics of community of interpreters > every text/element of corpus bequeathes/reproduces several injunctions
EU.linkedContent: interpretation of poem, philosopheme, theologeme always proposes an institutional model, consolidating an existing one or constituting a new one: calls for politics of community of interpreters > every text/element of corpus bequeathes/reproduces several injunctions

EU.content: every text opens/closes, double bind, undecidability, an overdetermination that can’t be mastered
EU.linkedContent: every text opens/closes, double bind, undecidability, an overdetermination that can’t be mastered

FV.content: letter found “in” the text which escapes, from 4th side, eyes of Dupin/analyst [letter not found in sealed interior of Poe’s tale, not assignable lack, definable hole]
FV.linkedContent: letter found “in” the text which escapes, from 4th side, eyes of Dupin/analyst [letter not found in sealed interior of Poe’s tale, not assignable lack, definable hole]

FV.content: the text The Purloined Letter: the open, the very open, letter that is fiction
FV.linkedContent: the text The Purloined Letter: the open, the very open, letter that is fiction

FV.content: at moment Dupin/Lacan finds letter [by drawing triangles/circles], moment it returns to its proper course, acc. desire of Queen, they no longer see the map itself: la carte that the “text” is, deviation of the four (l’écart du quatre) w/ no promise of topos or truth
FV.linkedContent: at moment Dupin/Lacan finds letter [by drawing triangles/circles], moment it returns to its proper course, acc. desire of Queen, they no longer see the map itself: la carte that the “text” is, deviation of the four (l’écart du quatre) w/ no promise of topos or truth

FV.content: The Purloined Letter, title of the text, not only its object; everyone drops (laisser tomber) [the text] like they do the preface
FV.linkedContent: The Purloined Letter, title of the text, not only its object; everyone drops (laisser tomber) [the text] like they do the preface

FV.content: mise en abyme of title [The Purloined…]: the text is the object
FV.linkedContent: mise en abyme of title [The Purloined…]: the text is the object

WBH.content: as members of a university, we are all guardians of Law, and also naive in front of text, in front of Law [like both characters in Kafka’s “Before the Law”]; p. 193 Law in Kafka’s story neither male nor female
WBH.linkedContent: as members of a university, we are all guardians of Law, and also naive in front of text, in front of Law [like both characters in Kafka’s “Before the Law”]; p. 193 Law in Kafka’s story neither male nor female
